column4: i have an .iso, and i would like to create a bootable usb with it, as well as boot other operating systems, such as fedora, opensuse, etc
i have the usb successfully booting, and i can boot the kernel and initrd, but it fails looking for the cdrom
do i just put the .iso in the same directory as the kernel/initrd?
are you trying to boot an iso
i'm trying to install ubuntu from usb
the alternate installer iso or desktop
installed grub2 to the usb stick ?
syslinux. the usb stick boots fine. the ubuntu installer just can't locate the cdrom media
wipe it, install grub2 to it and put the iso somewhere and make a grub.cfg
ubuntu and debian are the only two that aren't. yet.
i've both spooled the media, and placed the .iso in the root of the ubuntu folder
oh, well.... I use grub2 to multi boot stuff.. cant help, sorry
